items.summary: Victoria has upset reigning Sheffield Shield holders South Australia at the Adelaide Oval.

items.title: Surfer bitten twice by shark chasing seal off Kangaroo Island
items.summary: A surfer who was twice bitten by a shark that was reportedly chasing a seal in waters off Kangaroo Island, is recovering well with a coffee, according to his boss.

items.title: Police tactical operation in Revesby leaves cars with holes, windows smashed
items.summary: A major police operation has taken place in Sydney's south-west after tactical operations officers conducted a "high risk" arrest on a suburban street.

items.title: Man in hospital after shooting near Mackay
items.summary: A man is in hospital in a stable condition after being shot in the hip during an altercation at a cane farm south of Mackay.

items.title: Australia Kangaroos lose Xavier Coates and Zac Lomax ahead of rugby league Ashes in England
items.summary: Australia suffers a double blow with Zac Lomax and Xavier Coates ruled out of the overseas tour through injury.

items.title: State of WA appeals $2.8 million compensation payment to Dion Barber for abuse in state care
items.summary: The state of WA is appealing a record $2.8 million compensation payment awarded to Dion Barber, who suffered repeated sexual abuse while in state care during the 1980s and 1990s.

items.title: Gold Coast mayor says Qld government hoarding cyclone recovery funds
items.summary: Gold Coast mayor Tom Tate is calling for the state government to hand over funding allocated to help cover the city's growing disaster recovery bill following Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

items.summary: Beth Mooney has predicted Australia's new approach to ODI cricket will pay off in the Women's Cricket World Cup, with a greater desire to take the game on.

items.title: Suspects in Bega stabbing death still at large, as police rule out chainsaw injuries
items.summary: Authorities say they are still piecing together who was involved in a "violent altercation" that left a man fatally stabbed and another in hospital.

items.title: Gerard Community Council Aboriginal Corporation pleads guilty to failing to lodge reports
items.summary: The corporation has been fined $2,000 for failing to lodge reports to the Office of the Registrar of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Corporations.

items.title: SA childcare centre closed for 90 days amid supervision concerns
items.summary: The Education Standards Board has closed Edge Early Learning Centre at Plympton for 90 days following an investigation into reports of "inadequate supervision" of children.

items.title: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship
items.summary: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

items.title: Wilcannia Weir project relies on increased federal funding, NSW minister says
items.summary: After decades of lobbying and design controversy, the New South Wales government says it needs another $30â€“40 million to proceed with the Wilcannia Weir upgrade.

items.title: Jarvis Cocker on his wild wedding, Glastonbury, and Pulp's first album in 24 years
items.summary: Love was "always problematic" for Jarvis Cocker, who fronts Britpop icons Pulp. But after decades of cynical songs on the subject, he's beginning to change his tune on romance.

items.title: Hikers feared being buried by snow as blizzard hit Mount Everest
items.summary: Hundreds of hikers are still trapped at an elevation of more than 4,900 metres as rescuers work to clear deep snow.

items.title: South Australia declared free from brown rugose fruit virus after more than a year
items.summary: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

items.title: What the Health of the Nation report tells us about GP doctors by numbers

items.title: Planning can help save you money this festive season

items.title: ABC Sport cricket coverage announced for the Ashes 2025/26 as Australia hosts England
items.summary: Darren Lehmann and Glenn McGrath will join a first-class line-up of cricket talent for ABC Sport's coverage of the Ashes.

items.title: Falling over a leading cause of hospitalisation, Injury Matters report highlights
items.summary: Data shows one in three people aged over 65 will have a fall every year. But a Perth not-for-profit wants to send a message that falls are not an inevitable part of ageing.

items.title: Rescuers pull children from the rubble of Indonesian boarding school collapse
items.summary: Rescue teams worked around the clock through narrow gaps in the rubble of Sidoarjo's Al Khoziny Islamic Boarding School while risking further collapse to reach anyone still alive.

items.title: Artemios Mintzas faces court for the first time on charges over Croydon Park shooting
items.summary: The 60-year-old accused of shooting at over a dozen random members of the public in suburban Sydney has faced a magistrate after two lawyers got into an argument over who was representing him.

items.title: Mother of Australian arrested on Gaza flotilla pleads for government to 'stand up for my son'
items.summary: Jacinta McEwan calls for the Australian government to help her son amid reports he has been physically abused after being arrested on a flotilla trying to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza.

items.title: Kimberley bushfire season sees flames burn area double the size of Sydney
items.summary: This year's northern bushfire season has been dubbed "one of the toughest on record", with blazes having burnt through about 2.7 million hectares of land in WA's Kimberley region.

items.title: Australia's last paper mill, Tasmania's Boyer Mill, locked in energy security negotiations with Aurora
items.summary: Aurora Energy is seeking a $7 million bank guarantee to cover energy costs for the Boyer Mill in southern Tasmania, but the paper mill's owner says the request is "obscene".

items.title: AC Milan to host Serie A match in Perth in what UEFA says is a 'regrettable' situation
items.summary: AC Milan will host a Serie A match in Perth next year, as UEFA's hand appears to have been forced to allow the game to go ahead.

items.title: Ord Valley's northern food bowl 'pipe dream' struggles amid changing climate

items.title: New WA program aims to improve access to childcare for children with disabilities
items.summary: An Australian-first pilot program gets underway in WA in the hope of not only giving the parents of children with complex needs a break, but helping them navigate the maze of different support systems.

items.title: Bayer announces Roundup alternative with rollout of new weedkiller in Australia
items.summary: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

items.title: Daria Kasatkina ends 2025 tennis season early, citing burnout
items.summary: Daria Kasatkina ends her 2025 WTA season early, citing the hectic schedule and a high-stress year after switching nationalities to Australia from Russia.

items.title: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing on Robbins Island
items.summary: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing after admitting he camped beyond the boundary line whilst visiting privately owned Robbins Island to observe migratory birds.

items.title: Drought conditions forcing kangaroo mobs to descend on farms, consuming scarce resources
items.summary: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

items.title: Singapore PM Lawrence Wong signals 'shared interests' with Australia and desire to expand military ties
items.summary: Singapore wants to expand its military ties with Australia, including through a greater Australian troop presence in the island state as part of an upgraded trade and defence relationship, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

items.title: Bulk-billing rates remain low as GPs spend longer with patients, survey finds
items.summary: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

items.title: Songbird heard for first time since 1890s in WA park
items.summary: The song of the noisy scrub-bird is being heard in WA's West Cape Howe National Park again, bringing joy to bird enthusiasts everywhere.

items.title: Victorian couple sues Barwon Health over delayed diagnosis of rare 'flesh-eating disease' necrotising fasciitis
items.summary: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.

items.title: Expert cautions people using AI as search for missing boy in SA outback scaled back

items.summary: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley raises the case of a trans child abuser as she seeks to pressure the Albanese government to create mandatory minimum jail terms for child exploitation offences.

items.title: New data shows Australia's extreme weather losses among highest in world

items.summary: After two years of war, a fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad.

items.title: Victoria's prisoner numbers outpace population growth, expected to rise further, report finds
items.summary: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

items.title: Australians released from Israeli detention after alleged beatings, according to DFAT report
items.summary: Seven Australian activists arrested while trying to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza have been deported to Jordan, the ABC understands.

items.title: Alleged Croydon Park gunman Artemios Mintzas charged with 25 offences
items.summary: Artemios Mintzas, 60, will appear in a Sydney court charged over an alleged shooting spree that shut down an inner-west suburb for about two hours on Sunday night.

items.title: English author Jilly Cooper, writer of The Rutshire Chronicles, dies at age 88
items.summary: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

items.title: Perth Royal Show attendance slumps to eight-year low

items.title: Papua New Guinea may sit out potential conflict between Australia and China despite Pukpuk defence treaty
items.summary: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape says there is a "high possibility" the country would not enter a conflict involving Australia and China, despite having signed a mutual defence treaty with its southern neighbour.
